If you're wondering why the game is so janky, has a bunch of dead ends and most anti-virus software flag it as potentially harmful, there's a very simple reason for that: the game is a Windows Command Prompt batch script wrapped into an executable file with a tool called batch2exe, then packaged inside a dropper that places the file in your temp folder and runs it, which is in turn packed with UPX. The pros :
-Nice retro BBS era feel to the game
-Adult themes, unicorns and text based gameplay blended together
- Pricepoint is rock bottom and with trading cards some people might consider that a winning combo

The cons :
-Mechanically disappointing, drawing down the decision grid to navigate each level would not even draw a maze, or even a mansion. I would probablt end up with a crude junior one bedroom
-There is no wit to the text, it half heartedly throws in references to sexual things and pop culture references and thats the crux of the appeal here. The limited novelty feeling of seeing this in a text based game dies quickly
-You will complete the game after 5 levels by acting like a blind lab rat and end up losing. As far as I can tell the game will return a game loss screen
-Not early access as far as the store page is concerned - so i guess this is the final version
-You will have to continually unquarantine the executable of this game as it gets flagged as being a trojan by most common antiviruses. I have faith that the community and steam would not allow a proper trojan to use the steam platform as a launching pad but that faith might be misplaced, and even so, the inconvenience caused by this problem is equal or greater than the enjoyment that comes from actually playing the game
-I am reaching my saturation point with trading card games, steam and the community will push the concept to its breaking point exploiting people with addictive personalities until most of them opt out and the system starts devaluing everything by lack of demand or at some point we will get horror stories like we see for gambling and we might get negative attention from the media and policy makers... Nothing I look forward to... *frowns*

Conclusion : Should have been made into a free flash game outside of steam for those interested, which would have been mostly nobody - which goes to show that steam really enables the showcasing of stuff people do not want and getting it onto people`s hard drives.

reviewText:
DONT WATCH THE TV! You might enjoy it :P

This game was enjoyable and it had its amusing parts throughout but the game is VERY linear, you are dropped in a world that feels like a pick-a-path adventure book but really all choices put you on the same path or you end up starting over. I really thought this game would be longer than it was... took me a space of 15mins to read through all text and explore every  possible option. I dont mind text based games but this one was way TOO short for even my liking. Still bought it with a discount, was not expecting much and really just wanted the badges and cards that came with. And the thought of prancing around as a gay unicorn sounded amusing.

Pros:
* A good laugh on some levels
* Short and sweet..
* You get cards for badges
* Made in mind for perverted furries

Cons:
* English spelling needs work, I picked up on numerous errors and a few words that took me a while to figure out what they were meant to be
* TOO SHORT
* Linear story, limited choices

I wouldnt recommend it unless you just want cards, theres better stuff to download out there online for no cost of the same concept story. Disappointed honestly, this kind of thing has the potential to be something a lot greater!
